search.matchingResults: {n, plural, one {# matching result} other {# matching results}}
search.help: Use filters like user:, project: or organization: to refine searches. Use sort: to order results.

private.title: Private
private.description: Documents will only be visible to you

organization.title: Organization
organization.description: Documents will only be visible to your organization

public.title: Public
public.description: Documents will be publicly visible to everyone

dialogReprocessDialog.title: Confirm reprocess
dialogReprocessDialog.reprocessDocs: Proceeding will force the following {n, plural, one {selected document} other {# selected documents}} to reprocess page and image text:
dialogReprocessDialog.reprocessSingleDoc: Proceeding will force the following document to reprocess page and image text:

dialogDocumentEmbedDialog.respOnHelp: Fill the width of the article container (usually works best)
dialogDocumentEmbedDialog.respOffHelp: The document will fit the sizes specified below
dialogDocumentEmbedDialog.widthFixed: Set a maximum width, in pixels
dialogDocumentEmbedDialog.heightAuto: The height is based on the size of the document, with no maximum size
dialogDocumentEmbedDialog.sbResponsiveHelp: Show sidebar automatically on large screens and hide on mobile devices. In embed mode, the sidebar will be hidden
dialogDocumentEmbedDialog.tVisibleHelp: Display the title and attribution in the header of the viewer
dialogDocumentEmbedDialog.tHiddenHelp: Hide the title in the header of the viewer (still visible in the sidebar)
dialogDocumentEmbedDialog.plVisibleHelp: Show a link to the raw PDF document in the sidebar
dialogDocumentEmbedDialog.plHiddenHelp: Hide the sidebar PDF link (file is still accessible if the URL is known)
dialogDocumentEmbedDialog.fsVisibleHelp: Show a fullscreen icon in the bottom-right corner
dialogDocumentEmbedDialog.tmVisibleHelp: Show an option to view the document’s text in the view dropdown
dialogDocumentEmbedDialog.cbfUserAndOrgHelp: Show a document’s attribution as the user name followed by the organization
dialogDocumentEmbedDialog.cbfOrgOnlyHelp: Attribute the document to just the organization

upgrade.message: Pro and Organization users can record and access the entire version history of their documents.

uploadDialog.title: Upload documents
uploadDialog.description: Select or drag a document to begin the document upload process. You will then be able to edit document information.
uploadDialog.dragDrop: Select, paste or drag-and-drop files to upload
uploadDialog.totalFiles: Total: {n, plural, one {# file} other {# files}}
uploadDialog.revisionControlHelp: All previous versions to the document will be preserved and available for download.
uploadDialog.tesseract: Tesseract is an open source OCR engine available free to all DocumentCloud accounts.
uploadDialog.textract: Textract is a more powerful OCR engine that can better handle messy text, handwriting and fuzzy scans.
uploadDialog.empty: Get started by selecting, pasting or dragging-and-dropping files
uploadDialog.success: Upload complete. Your documents will process in the background.
uploadDialog.error: Error during upload. See upload list for more details.

premiumUpgrade.title: Upgrade
premiumUpgrade.heading: Go Pro with DocumentCloud’s premium tools
premiumUpgrade.description: Upgrade to a Professional plan to search document annotations and access Premium Add-Ons like advanced OCR, GPT-driven document analysis, and more.

org.userCount: {n, plural, one {# organization member} other {# organization members}}

unverified.verify: Before you can upload documents, we need to verify your account. DocumentCloud verification is available to newsrooms, academic institutions, researchers, legal clinics and non-profits that have a track record of posting vetted primary source materials in the public interest. If you are working with an eligible organization, please join their organization account.
unverified.allowed_actions: If you are not eligible for verification, you can still search the public repository, organize documents you're interested in into projects, make private notes, and collaborate on editing and annotating documents other users invite you to.
unverified.faq: Read more about verification in our FAQ

documents.matchingPages: {n, plural, one {# page} other {# pages}} matching the query
documents.matchingNotes: {n, plural, one {# note} other {# notes}} matching the query

noDocuments.queryNoResults: Your search query returned no results. Try again with a broader search query.

processingBar.processingDocuments: {n, plural, one {# document} other {# documents}} remaining

projects.add: Add {n, plural, one {this document} other {# documents}} to a project

delete.really: Are you sure you want to delete this project ({project})?

remove.label: Remove collaborator
remove.message: Proceeding will remove {name} from {title}. Do you wish to continue?

update.label: Change access
update.message: Select an access level for {name} in {title}

invite.label: Invite collaborators
invite.message: Enter the email of an existing DocumentCloud user. If they don't have an account, have them register here for free, and then ask them to log in to DocumentCloud at least once.

admin.title: Admin
admin.description: Admins can add and remove documents and collaborators to the project

edit.title: Editor
edit.description: Editors can see and edit project documents owned by project admins

view.title: Viewer
view.description: Viewers can see project documents owned by project admins

collaborators.empty: You have not yet added any collaborators to this project. Invite collaborators to grant other users access to the documents shared in this project. You can control whether collaborators have access to view/edit the project’s documents or be an admin with permissions to invite other users and edit the project itself.

embedNote.viewTheNote: View the note ‘{title}‘ in its original document context on DocumentCloud in a new window or tab

embedPage.viewDoc: View entire {title} on DocumentCloud in new window or tab
embedPage.gotoDocCloud: Go to DocumentCloud in new window or tab

data.title: Tags & Data
data.empty: Use tags or key/value data to organize documents

toc.empty: Sections organize your document with a table of contents

notes.empty: Add notes to highlight and comment on your document

edit.title: Edit Document Metadata

fields.title: Title
fields.noindex: Hide from search engines and DocumentCloud search

access.title: Access
access.description: Changing the access setting will reprocess your document.

edit.nodocs: No documents selected. Close this form and select at least one document first.
edit.many: Editing {n, plural, one {one document} other {# documents}}. This will add the same values to all selected documents.
edit.allowedHTML: Limited HTML can be used for formatting. See API documentation for details.

annotate.title: Annotate Document
annotate.instructions: Highlight a portion of the page, or click between pages to create a note.

redact.title: Redact Document
redact.really: Are you sure you wish to redact the current document? If you continue, the document viewer will be inaccessible temporarily while the document reprocesses with the redactions in place. This change is irreversible.
redact.instructions: Click and drag to draw a black rectangle over each portion of the document you’d like to redact. Associated text will be removed when you save your redactions.
redact.cancelWarning: You will lose unsaved redactions. Are you sure you want to cancel?

sections.title: Title
sections.overwrite: There is already a section starting on page {n}.

delete.title: Confirm Delete
delete.really: Proceeding will permanently delete the {n, plural, one {selected document} other {# selected documents}}.
delete.none: No documents selected. Close this form and select at least one document first.

data.title: Edit Tags & Data
data.many: Saving will add the following tags and data to {n, plural, one {the selected document} other {all # selected documents}}. No tags or data will be removed.

addonDispatchDialog.select: Documents to run this Add-On against:
addonDispatchDialog.labelSelected: The {n, plural, one {# currently selected document} other {# currently selected documents}}
addonDispatchDialog.labelQuery: The {n, plural, one {# document} other {# documents}} from the current search results
addonDispatchDialog.selectionHelp: Select individual documents or run a search for the documents you want, for example “+project:mueller-docs-200005”.
addonDispatchDialog.selectionLearnMore: Learn more about how Add-Ons work
addonDispatchDialog.noHistory: You have not run this Add-On before

addonBrowserDialog.title: Browse Add-Ons
addonBrowserDialog.subtitle: Free automations, shortcuts and power-ups from the DocumentCloud community
addonBrowserDialog.pinnedTip: Quickly access your favorite Add-Ons by clicking the “Pin” icon next to its name. They’ll then be available to run from the Add-Ons dropdown menu.
addonBrowserDialog.featuredTip: Here’s some of the DocumentCloud team’s favorite Add-Ons, including both new additions as well as classics we think every user should try.
addonBrowserDialog.premiumTip: Premium add-ons have powerful functionality backed by AI and cloud services. They have an additional cost to run and are only available to Professional and Organizational users.

mailkey.title: Upload via email
mailkey.description:
You can upload documents to your account by sending them to to a special email address as attachments.

For security reasons, this email is only shown to you once. Please copy it to a secure location.

This address will accept attachments from any email account. Documents are uploaded as private. Generating a new upload address will disable any previously created addresses.

We’d love your feedback and to hear about creative use cases at info@documentcloud.org.

create.failure: Failed to create your upload email address. Please try again later.

destroy.success: Any upload email address has been removed from your account.
destroy.failure: Failed to destroy your upload email address. Please try again later.

share.orgWarning: This {type} is only visible within your organization.

feedback.title: Share Your Feedback
feedback.hello: Thanks for trying out the public preview for the next major version of DocumentCloud! We are still hard at work adding features, fixing bugs, and improving the experience. We welcome your feedback—comments, ideas, and questions—to inform our progress. We are a very small team so we cannot guarantee that we will respond to all feedback, but we will read and review all of it.
feedback.success: We have received your feedback. Thank you!
